tags.title: Tags
tags.description1: A tag is a keyword or label that categorizes your question with other similar questions.
tags.description2: Using the right tags makes it easier for others to find and answer your question.

javascript.tagDesc: For questions regarding programming in ECMAScript (JavaScript/JS) and its various dialects/implementations (excluding ActionScript). Please include all relevant tags on your question.

python.tagDesc: Python is a multi-paradigm, dynamically typed, multipurpose programming language. It is designed to be quick to learn, understand, and use, and enforces a clean and uniform syntax.

csharp.tagDesc: C# (pronounced 'see sharp') is a high level, statically typed, multi-paradigm programming language developed by Microsoft.

java.tagDesc: Java is a high-level object oriented programming language. Use this tag when you're having problems using or understanding the language itself.

php.tagDesc: PHP is a widely used, open source, general-purpose, multi-paradigm, dynamically typed and interpreted scripting language originally designed for server-side web development.

html.tagDesc: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the markup language for creating web pages and other information to be displayed in a web browser.

android.tagDesc: Android is Google's mobile operating system, used for programming or developing digital devices (Smartphones, Tablets, Automobiles, TVs, Wear, Glass, IoT).

css.tagDesc: CSS is a representation style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of HTML, XML documents and SVG elements including colors, layout, fonts, and animations.

reactjs.tagDesc: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It uses a declarative, component-based paradigm and aims to be both efficient and flexible.

nodejs.tagDesc: Node.js is an event-based, non-blocking, asynchronous I/O runtime that uses Google's V8 JavaScript engine and libuv library.

askquestion.title: Ask a public Question
askquestion.title_description: Be specific and imagine you're asking a question to another person
askquestion.title_placeholder: e.g. Is there an R function for finding the index of an element in a vector?
askquestion.body_description: Include all the information someone would need to answer your question
askquestion.tags_description: Add up to 5 tags to describe what your question is about
askquestion.success_alert: You have successfully posted a question
